description: When the user feels overwhelmed with fear, worry, or panic about life, future, or inner battles — and is seeking peace and assurance through faith.

primary.text_en: Surely in the remembrance of Allah do hearts find rest.
primary.explanation: This ayah directly addresses anxious hearts — the solution is dhikr, remembrance of Allah.

primary.text_en: Allah does not burden a soul beyond what it can bear.
primary.text_ar: لَا يُكَلِّفُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا
primary.explanation: Anxiety often lies to us. This ayah is Allah’s reminder: you’re stronger than you think.

primary.text_en: So do not lose heart nor fall into despair—you will be superior if you are true believers.
primary.text_ar: فَلَا تَهِنُوا۟ وَلَا تَحْزَنُوا۟ وَأَنتُمُ ٱلْأَعْلَوْنَ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
primary.explanation: When you feel down and anxious — this verse reminds you to hold on with belief.

primary.text_en: He said, 'Fear not. Indeed, I am with you both; I hear and I see.'
primary.text_ar: قَالَ لَا تَخَافَآ إِنَّنِى مَعَكُمَآ أَسْمَعُ وَأَرَىٰ
primary.explanation: Allah’s words to Musa and Harun — a divine reassurance that He is always watching and listening.

primary.text_en: O you who have believed, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.
primary.text_ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ ٱسْتَعِينُواْ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَٱلصَّلَوٰةِ...
primary.explanation: Feeling anxious? Start with patience and prayer — help will come.

extra.text_en: Verily, in the remembrance of Allah, hearts find tranquility.
extra.text_ar: وَمَا ٱلنَّصْرُ إِلَّا مِنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
extra.explanation: Victory and peace come from Allah alone — trust in Him removes fear.

extra.text_en: And put your trust in Allah. And Allah is sufficient as Disposer of affairs.
extra.text_ar: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ وَكِيلًۭا
extra.explanation: Let go of what's beyond your control — Allah is enough to manage it.

extra.text_en: Unquestionably, for the allies of Allah there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
extra.text_ar: أَلَآ إِنَّ أَوْلِيَآءَ ٱللَّهِ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
extra.explanation: Those who are close to Allah — fear and sadness can’t take over them.

extra.text_en: And those who strive for Us - We will surely guide them to Our ways.
extra.explanation: If you’re struggling through anxiety for Allah’s sake, He promises to guide you.

extra.text_en: Indeed, with hardship comes ease. Indeed, with hardship comes ease.
extra.text_ar: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًۭا ﴿٥﴾ إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًۭا ﴿٦﴾
extra.explanation: Repeated twice — a guarantee that ease is always paired with hardship.

primary.text_en: Whoever makes the Hereafter his concern, Allah will place richness in his heart, organize his affairs, and the world will come to him despite being reluctant.
primary.explanation: Anxiety about dunya fades when your focus is the akhirah.

primary.text_en: If you were to rely upon Allah with the reliance He is due, He would provide for you just as He provides for the birds...
primary.explanation: True trust removes worry — like the bird who flies hungry but returns full.

primary.text_en: The Prophet ﷺ said, 'Do not worry. Verily, Allah is with us.'
primary.explanation: Even in life-threatening fear, the Prophet ﷺ taught calm and trust.

primary.text_en: Nothing strikes a Muslim, hardship, pain, anxiety... except that Allah expiates his sins because of it.
primary.explanation: Your anxiety is not wasted — it cleanses your soul if you’re patient.

primary.text_en: When one of you is anxious or distressed, let him say: 'O Allah, I hope for Your mercy. Do not leave me to myself...'
primary.explanation: There’s even a dua *just for anxiety* — the Prophet ﷺ taught us how to cope.

extra.text_en: The strong believer is more beloved to Allah than the weak believer, though both are good...
extra.explanation: Build mental and spiritual resilience — Allah loves strength.

extra.text_en: There is no Muslim who is afflicted with distress and says: 'O Allah, I am Your slave, son of Your slave...' except that Allah removes his worry.
extra.explanation: This powerful dua (known as 'Dua of Distress') works when said with the heart.

extra.text_en: The Prophet ﷺ would seek refuge from anxiety and sorrow, saying: 'O Allah, I seek refuge in You from worry and grief...'
extra.explanation: Even the Prophet sought refuge from this — it’s part of life.

extra.text_en: Allah never tires of giving until you tire of asking.
extra.explanation: Don’t stop making dua even if anxiety is recurring.

extra.text_en: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'The hearts are between the fingers of Allah, and He turns them as He wills.'
extra.explanation: Your state can change anytime — keep turning to Him.

duas.text_en: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from anxiety and sorrow, weakness and laziness...
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ، وَالْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ...
duas.explanation: This is a well-known dua of the Prophet ﷺ specifically for anxiety.

duas.text_en: O Ever-Living, O Sustainer, by Your mercy I seek relief. Rectify for me all of my affairs and do not leave me to myself...
duas.text_ar: يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّومُ، بِرَحْمَتِكَ أَسْتَغِيثُ...
duas.explanation: A dua to surrender your fear to the One who controls everything.

reflection: Anxiety tells you everything is falling apart. But Allah is telling you: *I am with you, I hear you, I will make a way*. Your chest may feel tight, your thoughts may race — but His mercy is closer than your breath. Anchor yourself to dhikr, prayer, and trust. This storm will pass.
